data.title: Fonz motorcycle, other movie classic cars on display at Hagerty
data.meta_description: GRAND TRAVERSE COUNTY, Mich. , (WPBN/WGTU) -- If you have a love for classic cars, films and TV shows, you'll appreciate this month's car display at Hagerty in Downtown Traverse City. For the month of February, Hagerty brought in Herbie the Love Bug. The car on display is the actual car driven by Lindsey Lohan in the 2005 remake movie 'Herbie Fully Loaded'. Hagerty said the love bug has drawn in people from all across the region who are then surprised to see the other classics.
data.text:
GRAND TRAVERSE COUNTY, Mich., (WPBN/WGTU) -- If you have a love for classic cars, films and TV shows, you'll appreciate this month's car display at Hagerty in Downtown Traverse City.

For the month of February, Hagerty brought in Herbie the Love Bug.

The car on display is the actual car driven by Lindsey Lohan in the 2005 remake movie 'Herbie Fully Loaded'.

Hagerty said the love bug has drawn in people from all across the region who are then surprised to see the other classics.

Another car in display at Hagerty is one of the race cars used in 'Spin Out' starring Elvis Presley.

And, who doesn't like the Fonz?!

Henry Winkler was a stud on Happy Days but reportedly wasn't that great at driving a motorcycle.

If you look closely, you can see a dent left in the gas tank from one of his crashes on set.

Hagerty staff said these kind of classics speak to all generations.

"It's always interesting when the car itself becomes the star in pop culture and people always have a way of assigning certain memories or certain experiences to the car and so to many people it's just as exciting to people to see the car that was used in the film as it would be to meet the stars themselves," said Jonathan Klinger, The Vice President of Public Relations at Hagerty.

Hagerty said the classics will be on display until they get picked up from the building early Friday afternoon.
